viz module¶

I have developed this module to either reproduce figures of [1] and plot interesting quantities. Figures are saved in the``results`` folder with proper name (inherited from the simulation object).

viz.animator(fig, axs, imgs, vals, ts_bins=[])[source]¶

Makes the firing rate animation.

viz.get_cax(ax)[source]¶

Returns a human-friendly colorbar axis from a given ax, to be used with matplotlib’s colorbar method.

viz.overlay_phis(phis, ax, size=5, color='k', scale=30, **kwargs)[source]¶
viz.plot_animation(sim, ss_dur=25, fps=10, overlay=True)[source]¶

Aggregates the firing rate from disk and make an animation.

Note

This function is inspired by the GitHub repo of [1].

Parameters:

  • sim (object) – simulate object

  • ss_dur (int, optional) – duration of each snapshot (frame) in animation in ms; defaults to 50 (corresponding to 50 ms)

viz.plot_connectivity(sim)[source]¶

Plots connectivity matrix of a given connectivity file and saves the figure in the results folder.

Parameters:

sim (object) – simulate object

viz.plot_field(field, figpath, vmin=None, vmax=None, phis=None)[source]¶

Plots a field; a landscape, firing rate, or any heatmap.

Parameters:

  • field (numpy array) – field as a 2D array

  • name (str) – saving name

  • vmin (float, optional) – minimum value of the field, defaults to None

  • vmax (float, optional) – maximum value of the field, defaults to None

viz.plot_firing_rates(sim, suffix='', conv_size=3, wl_size=10, z_score=False, overlay=True)[source]¶

Plots the overal firing rates within the active monitors of the sim objects. The firing rate is also covolved with a 2D ricker kernel to show the firing rate contrast better. It is also possibly to plot z-score of the firing rates as well.

Parameters:

  • sim (object) – simulate object

  • suffix (str, optional) – An optional suffix for saved figure name, defaults to ‘’

  • conv_size (int, optional) – Ricker kernel size, defaults to 3

  • wl_size (float, optional) – wavelet size of Ricker kernel, defaults to 10

  • z_score (book, optional) – Whether or not to plot the z-score, defaults to False

viz.plot_firing_rates_dist(sim)[source]¶

Plots the average firing rate density in log scale.

Parameters:

sim (object) – simulate object

viz.plot_firing_snapshots(sim, tmin=None, tmax=None, alpha=0.1)[source]¶

Similar to plot_firing_rates but plots the firing rates within an arbitrary interval between tmin and tmax` as a scatter plot.

viz.plot_in_out_deg(sim)[source]¶

Plots both in- and out-degree of each population within the sim object.

Parameters:

sim (object) – simulate object

viz.plot_landscape(sim, overlay=True)[source]¶

Plots the intended landscape (only \(\phi\)) for all the populations set in a simulation.

Parameters:

sim (object) – simulate object

viz.plot_periodicity(sim, N=10)[source]¶
viz.plot_realized_landscape(sim)[source]¶

Plots the realized landscape (only \(\phi\)) for all the populations set in a simulation.

Parameters:

sim (object) – simulate object
